sub_topic: Probability of a certain type of technological failure occurring in a system
message_1: A system has 4 main components with individual probabilities of failure as follows: Component 1 (0.02), Component 2 (0.04), Component 3 (0.03), and Component 4 (0.01). What is the probability that the entire system fails? Assume that the components are independent.
message_2:
Since the components are independent, the probability of the entire system failing is the product of the individual probabilities of failure for each component.

P(system fails) = P(Component 1 fails) * P(Component 2 fails) * P(Component 3 fails) * P(Component 4 fails)

P(system fails) = 0.02 * 0.04 * 0.03 * 0.01

P(system fails) = 0.0000024

So, the probability that the entire system fails is 0.0000024 or 2.4 * 10^(-6).
